column3: > How is this different from #16791?\n\n@MarcoFalke Despite similar naming, this is not the same thing as LTO. This will optimize the symbol hash tables in binaries, whereas LTO does intermodular optimizations. More info on either: [Optimizing Linker Load Times](https://lwn.net/Articles/192624/) and [LTO](https://llvm.org/docs/LinkTimeOptimization.html).
Concept ACK, good to know that it's different from LTO.\n\nNeed to look into it more carefully.

Concept ACK, although would like to see this in Gitian/release builds instead of default configure. At some point we should probably add a doc to the repo of recommended configure flags and what they do.

-----

It seems to me that, when supplied with `-O2`:

- `ld` optimizes the hash chain size for the symbol hash table, which may lead to larger outputs
- `ld.gold` optimizes the out

> Concept ACK, although would like to see this in Gitian/release builds instead of default configure. \n\nI agree, and I've change this to be a configure flag, `--enable-linker-optimizations` (off by default). Then we can pass it into gitian builds in future if desired. Going to follow up with some more info shortly.

Passing optimization flags to the link stage has been the default for decades in autotools projects (autoconf/automake/libtool).   Thus,

1) concept ACK
2) It should be enabled by default.
From #bitcoin-builds meeting notes today: We should switch to just adding the -Wl,-O2 to LDFLAGs in Gitian/Guix, and benchmark to see the differences.
